business.headline: Paytm clarifies FEMA allegations on acquired subsidiaries. Details hereThe company is seeking legal advice and will take necessary steps to resolve the matter through appropriate regulatory processes in line with applicable laws.

US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off 500 employees. Here's whyGrubhub is laying off as many as 500 employees, over 20 per cent of its workforce, following its acquisition by Wonder. The layoffs, spanning all departments, aim to streamline operations as the company integrates with its new parent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey assumes charge as 11th Sebi chairmanTuhin Kanta Pandey took charge as the 11th Sebi chairman, succeeding Madhabi Puri Buch, who completed her tenure. A former Finance Secretary, Pandey has been appointed for three years.

India to remain fastest growing major economy with 6.5% growth in FY26: IMFIndia's strong economic performance, the IMF said, provides an opportunity for the country to advance critical and challenging structural reforms to realise the ambition of becoming an advanced economy by 2047.

From record highs to a five-month slide: Where are Sensex, Nifty headed?From record highs to relentless losses, Dalal Street's dream run has turned into a nightmare in just a few months. Is there any relief in sight for investors or is there more pain ahead?

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath flags sharp drop in trading activity amid market crashThe stock market fell sharply on Friday, with the Sensex dropping 1,414 points and the Nifty slipping below 22,150. The heavy selling wiped out nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.

Citigroup employee's typo nearly led to $81 trillion blunder. Details hereThe payment was initially overlooked by two employees before a third employee caught it. Citi later reported the incident as a 'near miss' to the Federal Reserve and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC).

Don't miss these money deadlines in March 2025: Special FDs, ITR, and more In case you have missed reporting income or made an error in your ITR, you can still fix it. The final deadline for filing an  updated return (ITR-U) is March 31, 2025.

Sensex falls 1,400 points as trade war fears rattle D-Street, Rs 9 lakh crore goneStock market crash: During today's trading session, Dalal Street plunged as Sensex tumbled 1,414 points and Nifty sank below 22,150 amid global trade war fears and foreign sell-off, erasing nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.
GDP grows at 6.2% in Q3 2024-25, up from 5.6% in Q2For the financial year 2023-24, India recorded a real GDP growth rate of 9.2%, marking the highest annual growth in the past 12 years.

Nifty posts longest monthly losing streak in 29 years, over Rs 90 lakh crore goneForeign outflows, weak earnings and global uncertainty have wiped out over Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth from  since September 2024, when Nifty hit an all-time high of 26,277.35.

Technicolor India shuts down, over 3,000 employees affected The company currently employs 3,200 people across India, with nearly 3,000 in Bengaluru alone. The sudden move has left several employees in shock.

entertainment.headline: Honey Singh set to perform in Delhi, excited fans rush to the venueSinger and rapper Honey Singh is set to perform in Delhi today as part of his ongoing Millionaire India tour. Ahead of the concert, excited fans were seen rushing to the venue as soon as the gates opened.

Honey Singh on online negativity against him: I've been here before YouTube existedSinger and rapper Honey Singh took a dig at those spreading negativity about him through YouTube podcasts. During his Lucknow concert last night, he also spoke about his lifestyle changes.

Shreya Ghoshal's X account hacked: Tried every thing in my capacityRenowned singer Shreya Ghoshal has disclosed that her X account has been compromised since February 13. Despite efforts, she remains unable to access or delete the account.
Splitsvilla 15's Rushali Yadav-Harsh Arora engaged: Just perfectly usSplitsvilla 15 contestants Rushali Yadav and Harsh Arora are now engaged. The couple fell in love on the show.

Nadaaniyan trailer: Ibrahim, Khushi's romance comes with a priceIbrahim Ali Khan is all set to making his acting debut in Nadaaniyan, a love story with a secret deal. Also starring Khushi Kapoor, the film explores romance, ambition, and chaos. It will start streaming on Netflix from March 7.

Honey Singh returns to Delhi for sold-out Millionaire concert: What to expectYo Yo Honey Singh's Millionaire India Tour hits Delhi with a sold-out show, 20,000 fans, top celebs, and a surprise setlist. His parents will attend the concert, making this emotional homecoming extra special.

Honey Singh wishes to team up with Diljit Dosanjh, urges fans to make it happenSinger Honey Singh, currently touring India for his Millionaire India Tour, expressed his desire to collaborate with Diljit Dosanjh again during his recent concert in Lucknow. He urged fans to tag the Peaches singer, hoping to reunite for a new project.

Shabana Azmi reacts to comparisons between Dabba Cartel and Saas, Bahu Aur FlamingoShabana Azmi addressed concerns over comparisons between her Netflix show Dabba Cartel and Dimple Kapadia's Saas, Bahu Aur Flamingo, emphasising the unique elements of each series.

Singer Palash Sen on Diljit's concert culture remark, Euphoria 2.0 and remixesEuphoria's lead vocalist Palash Sen opened up about Diljit Dosanjh's controversial concert culture remark, the rebranding of the band and more in an exclusive interaction with India Today Digital. Sen recently collaborated with Bollywood star Akshay Kumar on the song, Mahakal Chalo.

Alter Ego review: Blackpink's Lisa's album is versatile and powerfulLisa of Blackpink releases her solo album Alter Ego. With a total of 15 songs and several collaborations, the album has a lot to take away from, but Lisa shines the brightest in her solo elements.

Ek Badnaam Aashram 3 part 2 review: Baba Nirala's journey meets a dramatic endReleased-Thu Feb 27, 2025Prakash Jha's most anticipated series, Aashram Season 3 Part 2, is currently streaming on MX Player. The series focusses on Baba Nirala's fate and how his entire kingdom crashes down because of Pammi's quest for revenge.

Dabba Cartel review: Shabana Azmi is a silent lioness in a challenging storyReleased-Fri Feb 28, 2025'Dabba Cartel' is supposed to be a powerful story of five women who team up to run a cartel in Mumbai. But, the Netflix series ends up becoming a mushy pie.

general news.headline: Trump's support crucial: Zelenskyy's stark message after Oval Office showdownA day after his tense confrontation with Donald Trump, Volodymyr Zelenskyy expressed gratitude to the United States for its unwavering support in Ukraine's fight against Russia. He also confirmed his readiness to sign a minerals agreement aimed at strengthening bilateral relations.

Bengal minister heckled, his car damaged during protest at Jadavpur UniversityWest Bengal Education Minister Bratya Basu was trapped in a two-hour standoff at Jadavpur University as student protesters vandalised his vehicle, demanding immediate student union elections.

New Zealand: The Holyfield to India's Tyson in ICC tournamentsEvery love story has a beginning, and so does every rivalry. India and New Zealand have played some riveting matches in the ICC tournaments in recent times. Here's how New Zealand are the Holyfield to India's Tyson in world cricket.

Uttarakhand avalanche: Four of 50 rescued workers die, search on for missing 4Rescue operations are in full swing as teams race against time to save four workers still trapped after an avalanche hit an Army camp near Mana village in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district. Authorities have successfully rescued 50 workers so far.

Harvard journal forced to drop article on Khalistani terrorism, faces backlashThe Harvard International Review unpublished an article on Khalistani terrorism and its impact on India-Canada ties by an Indian student after complaints from Sikh organisations, including Harvard's Sikh Chaplain. Harvard is facing backlash for pulling out the article, and a petition has been started to hold the Ivy League university accountable.

Own a 15-year-old vehicle in Delhi? You won't be able to refuel it from April 1Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said the government will install gadgets at all fuel pumps which will identify vehicles older than 15 years.

Ensure free movement on all Manipur roads from March 8: Amit Shah's big orderUnion Home Minister Amit Shah chaired a high-level meeting in New Delhi to review the security situation in Manipur on Saturday.

Moment Trump-Zelenskyy meet descended into chaos, JD Vance lit the fuseThe meeting started on a good note, with handshakes and smiles between Trump and Zelenskyy. However, all hell broke loose when Vice President JD Vance interjected to answer a question about Trump's support for Russia.

Hrithik Roshan collaborates with Farhan, Abhay: Took time, but we finally said YASZindagi Na Milegi Dobara gang Hrithik Roshan, Abhay Deol and Farhan Akhtar reunited for a fun project. The actors shared a picture with each other on Saturday, sparking buzz about the film's highly-anticipated sequel.

Temple board seeks no-fly zone over Tirumala to 'preserve its sanctity'The request was made keeping in mind the principles of Agama Shastra, the sanctity of the temple, and the safety and sentiments of the devotees.

US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off 500 employees. Here's whyGrubhub is laying off as many as 500 employees, over 20 per cent of its workforce, following its acquisition by Wonder. The layoffs, spanning all departments, aim to streamline operations as the company integrates with its new parent.

No redemption for Buttler as England return empty-handed from Champions TrophyEngland finished their Champions Trophy campaign with yet another loss on Saturday, March 1. There was no redemption for Jos Buttler after his team put up yet another terrible performance in the ICC tournament.

Reliving the timeless romance of Mughal-e-Azam, 64 years later, with a musicalThe lights bling, everyone settles down in their seats, curtains are lifted, live music begins and there they are - Saleem and Anarkali - batting their eyelashes, and writing the history of 'Mughal-e-Azam' on the stage. This is Feroz Abbas Khan's musical, a stage adaptation of K Asif's cinematic excellence.

What's keeping country liquors from making it to mainstream bar menus?While there's been a surge in the popularity of locally made alcohol, experts are also noticing a growing trend—country liquor making its way onto local bar menus.

Afghanistan knocked out, Proteas into semis after bowling England out for 179South Africa stormed into the semi-finals of the Champions Trophy after bowling out England for just 179 runs in the final match of Group B. With Proteas qualifying, Afghanistan were ruled out of the tournament.

Delhi to roll out Rs 2,500 scheme for women on March 8? Here's what BJP saidThe Delhi BJP is going to organise a gathering of around 5,000 Delhi women at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium on International Women's Day on March 8 and the rollout of the scheme is expected to be announced.

Marathas, Mughals and British: The treaties of Purandar that reshaped Indian historyThe two Treaties of Purandar, signed over a century apart, shaped Indian history. The first, in 1665, was a setback for the Marathas against the Mughals but did not halt their rise. The second, in 1776, exposed internal conflicts, allowing British interference.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Ancient Indian seafarers used coir-stitched ships to brave high seas. Here's whyA ship stitched together with coir ropes and resins has been launched by India. The ship made with ancient techniques will set sail to Oman this year to celebrate India's maritime excellence of yore. This is why stitched ships were used by ancient Indian seafarers, a tradition that was later borrowed by Yemenis and Omani Arabs.

Zelenskyy goes on thanking spree after Trump showdown over lack of gratitudeAfter being snubbed by both Vance and Trump for not being thankful enough, Zelenskyy went on a thanking spree as leaders from across Europe and Canada poured their support.

How legacy of Sir Ganga Ram, father of modern Lahore, lives on in PakistanWhile many people know about the famous Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi, a similar hospital is there in Lahore. The hospital in Lahore was built by Sir Ganga Ram in 1921.

MK Stalin calls all-party meet amid delimitation, 3-language row, BJP to boycottMK Stalin has called an all-party meeting on March 5 in Tamil Nadu's Chennai to discuss the proposed Lok Sabha delimitation and three-language policy, with BJP boycotting and AIADMK confirming participation.

Fear of tough divorce, pro-women laws drove him to suicide: Agra man's sisterManav Sharma, an IT firm employee, died by suicide on Febryary 24, allegedly due to strained relations with his wife. Before ending his life, Manav Sharma recorded an emotional video accusing his wife of having an affair.

From record highs to a five-month slide: Where are Sensex, Nifty headed?From record highs to relentless losses, Dalal Street's dream run has turned into a nightmare in just a few months. Is there any relief in sight for investors or is there more pain ahead?

Rasha Thadani and Govinda's son Yashvardhan groove to Akhiyon Se Goli MaareActor Rasha Thadani shared a heartfelt birthday wish for Yashvardhan Ahuja, son of actor Govinda. The video showcased their camaraderie as they dance to the iconic Akhiyon Se Goli Maare.

Honey Singh set to perform in Delhi, excited fans rush to the venueSinger and rapper Honey Singh is set to perform in Delhi today as part of his ongoing Millionaire India tour. Ahead of the concert, excited fans were seen rushing to the venue as soon as the gates opened.

Ibrahim Ali Khan steals the show in Nadaaniyan trailer, fans call him 'born actor'Ibrahim Ali Khan is making waves with his performance in the Nadaaniyan trailer. Ibrahim is making his debut with the film, releasing on Netflix on March 7.

Honey Singh on online negativity against him: I've been here before YouTube existedSinger and rapper Honey Singh took a dig at those spreading negativity about him through YouTube podcasts. During his Lucknow concert last night, he also spoke about his lifestyle changes.

sports.headline: WPL: Delhi peak at the right time, qualify for playoffs after hammering RCBDelhi Capitals handed Royal Challengers Bangalore their fourth consecutive defeat with a dominant nine-wicket victory on Saturday, March 1. The win helped DC qualify for the playoffs this season.

'Most reckless tackle in football history' sends Mateta to hospitalCrystal Palace footballer Jean-Philippe Mateta was knocked out cold in the FA Cup after a horrifying tackle from Liam Roberts on Saturday. Many fans on social media called it the worst tackle that they had ever seen on a football pitch.

Not the right person to ask: Vidarbha hero Karun Nair on national team call-upVidarbha batter Karun Nair scored a century in the second innings of the Ranji Trophy Final. Asked about a potential call-back in the Indian team, Nair said that he was not the right person to answer this question.

Facing Indian spinners not an easy task but we've got our plans: Glenn PhillipsNew Zealand all-rounder Glenn Phillips said that New Zealand have individual plans to counter India's spin threat in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025 clash against them. The two teams will square off on Sunday, March 1 in Dubai.

Having recently whitewashed India give New Zealand any advantage? Phillips answersNew Zealand all-rounder Glenn Phillips recently recalled New Zealand's 3-0 whitewash over India and said that their team will take the confidence from that result into the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 fixture between the two teams.

Virat Kohli's only competition is himself: Varun AaronIndia are set to play New Zealand in the final group-stage match of their Champions Trophy campaign. Virat Kohli will be in focus after scoring a stunning hundred in his final game.

Can Pakistan get one thing right in the Champions Trophy?Thirty minutes of rain washed out the contest between Afghanistan and Australia in the Champions Trophy. Why have Pakistan got so many things wrong in the return of ICC tournament in the country?

India vs New Zealand, all you need to know: Dubai pitch report, live streamingIndia and New Zealand are set to take on each other in the last group fixture of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Sunday, March 2. Both teams have remained unbeaten in the tournament and have qualified for the semi finals.

No redemption for Buttler as England return empty-handed from Champions TrophyEngland finished their Champions Trophy campaign with yet another loss on Saturday, March 1. There was no redemption for Jos Buttler after his team put up yet another terrible performance in the ICC tournament.

Former Pakistan players should lift their team up instead of criticising: GavaskarLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar feels former Pakistan cricketers should think more about lifting their team up instead of criticising them vehemently. Pakistan got knocked out of the Champions Trophy 2025 without registering a single win in the tournament.

Watch: Karachi black cat invades field once again during England vs South AfricaThe infamous Karachi black cat invaded the National Stadium once again during the England vs South Africa game on Saturday, March 1. The cat appeared on the field while South Africa were batting.

Can Pakistan get one thing right in the Champions Trophy?Thirty minutes of rain washed out the contest between Afghanistan and Australia in the Champions Trophy. Why have Pakistan got so many things wrong in the return of ICC tournament in the country?

India vs New Zealand, all you need to know: Dubai pitch report, live streamingIndia and New Zealand are set to take on each other in the last group fixture of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Sunday, March 2. Both teams have remained unbeaten in the tournament and have qualified for the semi finals.

No redemption for Buttler as England return empty-handed from Champions TrophyEngland finished their Champions Trophy campaign with yet another loss on Saturday, March 1. There was no redemption for Jos Buttler after his team put up yet another terrible performance in the ICC tournament.

Former Pakistan players should lift their team up instead of criticising: GavaskarLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar feels former Pakistan cricketers should think more about lifting their team up instead of criticising them vehemently. Pakistan got knocked out of the Champions Trophy 2025 without registering a single win in the tournament.

Watch: Karachi black cat invades field once again during England vs South AfricaThe infamous Karachi black cat invaded the National Stadium once again during the England vs South Africa game on Saturday, March 1. The cat appeared on the field while South Africa were batting.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
